bullets.text: Government shutdown set to become longest ever; White House warns pain could worsen; SNAP payments uncertainty.
U.S. job openings hit lowest since Feb 2021, Indeed says, signaling cooling labor demand.
SoftBank and Asian AI-linked stocks slump on valuation jitters, pressuring broader tech sentiment.
Bitcoin falls below $100,000 amid risk-off; sentiment shows retail capitulation, but no deep crypto winter expected.
Pinterest plunges 20% on earnings miss and weak holiday forecast, stoking ad-demand concerns.
Rivian beats revenue, maintains guidance; expiring U.S. EV credits boosted Q3 sales; shares rise.
IBM to cut thousands of jobs in Q4 amid AI-driven restructuring and cost pressures.
Private equity leaders forecast consolidation as too many funds chase deals; industry shakeout expected.
Norway’s wealth fund opposes Musk’s $1T pay package, intensifying governance scrutiny at Tesla.
U.S. seeks two-year UN mandate for Gaza stabilization force, signaling prolonged international presence.
Drone strike kills dozens at Sudan funeral, highlighting worsening conflict and humanitarian crisis.
Aramco: Saudi’s cheap energy aims to make kingdom a global AI data-center leader.
DHS plans expanded biometric collection, including iris scans and DNA, raising privacy and civil-liberties concerns.
Scientists discover ocean plastic-eating bacteria, suggesting scalable bioremediation pathways for marine waste.
New evidence questions Einstein’s cosmological constant, potentially reshaping dark-energy models.
